definitions.definition: A polyhedron with parallel ends of the same polygonal shape and size , the other faces being parallelogram - shaped sides .

subdefinitions.definition: An object having the shape of a geometrical prism ( sense 1 ) .

A cutting ( “ open passage at a level lower than the surrounding terrain , dug for a canal , railway , or road to go through ” ) or an embankment shaped like a prism ( sense 1 ) or a number of prisms, such that its volume can be easily calculated .
A crystal in which the faces are parallel to the vertical axis .
A transparent block in the shape of a prism ( sense 1 ) , typically with triangular ends, used to reflect or refract light . ( archaic ) A spectrum produced by light being refracted through a prism.

definitions.definition: A retroreflector ( “ device which reflects light back to its source with minimal scattering ” ) which is usually attached to a surveying pole as a target for a total station which emits a light beam at the device and calculates how long it takes to be reflected back in order to measure distance .
A perspective that colours one's perception .

main_definition: ( geometry ) A polyhedron with parallel ends of the same polygonal shape and size , the other faces being parallelogram - shaped sides .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension , surveying ) A retroreflector ( “ device which reflects light back to its source with minimal scattering ” ) which is usually attached to a surveying pole as a target for a total station which emits a light beam at the device and calculates how long it takes to be reflected back in order to measure distance .
( figurative ) A perspective that colours one's perception .
